title: Scratch 转 Python 转换器
description: 怎样把 Scratch 文件转换成 Python 代码？
step1hint: 第一步：请选择一个转换 Scratch 文件到 Python 代码的方式
step2hint: 请粘贴你的 Scratch 文件的网址链接
step2_file: 第二步：请上传以以下结尾的临时项目文件
step2subhint1: 像下面的链接一样（需要先分享你的 Scratch 项目）
link_input_placeholder: 粘贴你的 Scratch 项目链接
step2subhint2: 链接匹配的话，下一步按钮才会出现
step3subhint1: 黑框里的命令是实际运行的命令
step4hint: 第四步：预览生成的代码并且下载
thanks_info: 享受转换后的 Scratch 代码吧！
easyTutorialSentence1: 本教程将帮助您学习如何将您制作的任何草稿项目转换为 Python 编程语言。
easyTutorialSentence2: 下图显示了 Dot the dog 在他的自然栖息地中，它是……刮擦！
easyTutorialSentence3: 如果您想学习如何自己制作，请点击下面的代码！
easyTutorialSentence4: Scratch 是世界上最大的儿童免费编码社区，正在为计算机科学的未来铺平道路。
easyTutorialSentence5: 如果这是您第一次使用 scratch，请访问
easyTutorialSentence6: 如果您是 scratch 的新手，请单击加入 Scratch，否则单击登录。
easyTutorialSentence7: 现在您可以创建您的帐户并单击创建以创建您的项目！
easyTutorialSentence8: 如果您不知道从哪里开始，可以从上面的示例开始。
easyTutorialSentence10: 下一张图片是该项目的一部分，已转换为 Python。
easyTutorialSentence11: 你能在python代码和scratch代码中找到狗什么时候移动10步吗？
easyTutorialSentence12: 这是转换过程的简单示例！
easyTutorialSentence14: 下面代码中的 Self 指的是我们在程序中使用的精灵，在这种情况下，我们名为 Dot 的狗就是我们的精灵。
easyTutorialSentence15: Self 代表一个类的实例，在这种情况下，它代表当前状态下名为 Dot 的 Dog。
easyTutorialSentence16: 然后使用 Self 将狗移动 10 步并让他吠叫。
easyTutorialSentence17: 定义一个函数，该函数在单击绿色标志时启动，以便代码可以运行。
easyTutorialSentence18: The code below sets up the stage and sprite for your Scratch project
easyTutorialSentence19: 这使得我们的程序包括声音、图像、变量、服装和舞台。
easyTutorialSentence20: 你能找到 pystage 导入舞台和精灵的代码行吗？
easyTutorialSentence21: 'dot_c' 中 center_y 的数字是多少？
easyTutorialSentence22: 提示：dot_c 是 dot 的服装，在他移动时会移动他的腿。
easyTutorialSentence23: 如果最后一行代码调用函数 when_program_starts_1 并启动阶段，则该程序不会运行。
easyTutorialSentence25: To use PyStage you first need to make a scratch project
easyTutorialSentence26: and save it to your computer or copy your project link.
easyTutorialSentence27: Errors that can happen when generating
easyTutorialSentence29: This means that the website could not load the content for your project.
easyTutorialSentence31: URL is incorrect or scratch is having server issues while you are generating your project.
easyTutorialSentence33: Most likely there is something not implemented yet that you used in your project.
easyTutorialSentence34: Keep in mind PyStage is in working development and not everything may work as intended yet.
easyTutorialSentence35: When your project is generated this box will show up explaining what PyStage has not implemented yet.
easyTutorialSentence37: if you have any issues to report with PyStage.
easyTutorialSentence38: Now that your project is converted into python the next step is to run your project with Visual Studio Code!
easyTutorialSentence39: If you do not have Visual Studio Code you can download it with this link
easyTutorialSentence40: Download your code on our website.
easyTutorialSentence41: Take your zip file and unzip it by right-clicking the zip file and clicking
easyTutorialSentence42: Remember when you save your project on your computer what folder you put your project in.
easyTutorialSentence44: Go to Visual Studio Code and click file and Open Folder and open your unzipped folder.
easyTutorialSentence45: In the top left of your screen click terminal in Visual Studio Code.
easyTutorialSentence46: In the terminal navigate to your folder with your unzipped code by using the command cd
easyTutorialSentence47: Your file path may be different to mine, here is an example of my filepath.
easyTutorialSentence49: If you have not downloaded python before open Visual Studio Code and on the left side of your screen you should see a tab that is called extensions.
easyTutorialSentence50: Click extensions and then type Python and download what you see in the picture below.
easyTutorialSentence51: Requirements to pip install before you begin
easyTutorialSentence52: Open the terminal and pip install the following commands.
easyTutorialSentence53: For example run pip install wheel and continue to run pip install for everything on the list below.
easyTutorialSentence54: Finally after setting up your enviroment you can open your python code.
easyTutorialSentence55: Right-click inside the Python file editor and select Run Python File in Terminal to run the code and it should look like this.
easyTutorialSentence56: You could also in the terminal type Python pystagedog.py or whatever else you named your file.
easyTutorialSentence57: That is it! Enjoy your converted code!
mediumTutorialSentence1: This tutorial will take you through how to make a simple scratch game with a goal at the end!
mediumTutorialSentence2: There is one line of code missing in the image above from the game, can you guess what it is?
mediumTutorialSentence3: We will tell you the answer at the end of this tutorial.
mediumTutorialSentence4: For now lets go over each individual block of code and see what it does.
mediumTutorialSentence5: This block of code is executed when the green flag is clicked and it shows a message and resets the timer and score.
mediumTutorialSentence6: Click on events and drag when green flag is clicked to the script area.
mediumTutorialSentence7: Click on looks and drag the think block to the script area and write a message.
mediumTutorialSentence8: Click on sensing and drag reset timer to the script area.
mediumTutorialSentence9: Click on variables and drag set your_score to 0 to the script area.
mediumTutorialSentence10: Now I challenge you to find the rest of the blocks on your own!
mediumTutorialSentence11: This block of code is executed when the d key is pressed when you move right in the game.
mediumTutorialSentence12: If you are touching the Cheesy Puffs then a message pops up saying Yum!
mediumTutorialSentence13: You score then changes by 1 as long as you are touching the Cheesy Puffs
mediumTutorialSentence14: See how many points you can get before it disappears!
mediumTutorialSentence15: This code changes x by 10 or -10 based on if a or d is pressed on your keyboard.
mediumTutorialSentence16: A new costume is displayed for the cat to make the cat look like it is walking.
mediumTutorialSentence17: This code is used when the Cheesy Puffs touches Sprite1. (the cat)
mediumTutorialSentence19: the Cheesy Puffs goes to the cordinates x: 150 and y: -130 in our game.
mediumTutorialSentence20: The size of the Cheesy Puffs is set to 100% to reset any size changes from past games.
mediumTutorialSentence22: if the Cheesy Puffs are touching the cat then we wait 1 second.
mediumTutorialSentence23: In this one second try and get as many points as you can!
mediumTutorialSentence24: Then the size is set to 0% although this does not make the Cheesy Puffs completely dissapear off the screen.
mediumTutorialSentence25: We set the x and y cordinates to -1000 so you can not see the Cheesy Puffs on the screen.
mediumTutorialSentence26: When you press the green flag the x and y cordinates are reset to their original position.
mediumTutorialSentence27: This is our project converted into Python.
mediumTutorialSentence28: Can you find the Python function the matches with the Scratch blocks?
hardTutorialSentence1: This tutorial will teach you how to use clones and messages in a Scratch game.
hardTutorialSentence3: Eat more than 100 donuts in 30 seconds to win!
hardTutorialSentence4: Do not let Squirrel2 eats 100 donuts!
hardTutorialSentence5: Press w to move up, s to move down.
hardTutorialSentence6: a to move left and d to move right.
hardTutorialSentence7: Type how many copies of donuts you want.
hardTutorialSentence8: These donuts will spawn when you start the game.
hardTutorialSentence9: Can you think of a way you would improve this game to make it better for a user playing the game?
hardTutorialSentence10: The three sprites in this project are the squirrel, donuts and squirrel2.
hardTutorialSentence11: We will go through each sprite one by one.
hardTutorialSentence12: Here is the code for the squirrel sprite.
hardTutorialSentence13: This code block makes the squirrel win after he eats over 100 donuts.
hardTutorialSentence14: if donuts is greater then 100 we loop the following forever.
hardTutorialSentence15: We set the size to 1000%, the backdrop switches to stars and all other commands are stopped.
hardTutorialSentence16: This code makes the squirrel lose after 30 seconds of play time.
hardTutorialSentence17: if donuts is less then 100 then we wait until the timer is greater then 30 seconds.
hardTutorialSentence18: We then switch backdrop to stars and stop all other commands.
hardTutorialSentence19: if the squirrel is touching a Donut then we change the Donuts score by 1
hardTutorialSentence20: If the Donuts score is greater then 20 then shrink the squirrel to 30% the size and say a message.
hardTutorialSentence22: reset Donuts score to 0, reset the size of the squirrel and the backdrop.
hardTutorialSentence23: We say a message for 5 seconds and then say another message explaining the controls of the game.
hardTutorialSentence24: The message explaining the controls stops when the score is over 20 because we then say our hard mode message in the first code image above.
hardTutorialSentence25: Find this message: Hard Mode! I need 100 donuts!
hardTutorialSentence27: if the Donuts score is less then 100 then say
hardTutorialSentence29: Else if Donuts is greater then 100 then say
hardTutorialSentence31: If Donuts equals 100 then in our code this mean you still lose the game and no message is displayed.
hardTutorialSentence32: What message would you put in the code if the squirrels Donuts equals 100?
hardTutorialSentence33: This code executes the controls for the squirrel.
hardTutorialSentence34: If you press w you go up and if you press s you go down.
hardTutorialSentence35: If you press a you go left and if you press d you go right.
hardTutorialSentence36: This code is for the donut sprite in our game.
hardTutorialSentence38: In the stage sprite we make a block of code that broadcasts go!
hardTutorialSentence41: We receive the message go! when the blue flag is clicked in the type box.
hardTutorialSentence42: This box asks you how many copies of donuts you want to spawn when you play the game.
hardTutorialSentence43: Once you press the check mark on the type box we hide the text box and spawn the donuts.
hardTutorialSentence44: We repeat the number of clones typed in the type box and make them go to a random position.
hardTutorialSentence45: We then set x2 to an x position and set y2 to an y position and create clone of myself.
hardTutorialSentence46: When I start as a clone
hardTutorialSentence47: the donut goes to x: x2 and y: y2.
hardTutorialSentence48: This makes the donuts spawn in random locations.
hardTutorialSentence49: We set rotation style to don't rotate and show the donuts.
hardTutorialSentence50: We loop forever brownian motion. Brownian motion is a block in Scratch.
hardTutorialSentence51: A block in scratch acts like a built in function that can be called at any time.
hardTutorialSentence52: Then we glide the donuts for 5 seconds to a random position.
hardTutorialSentence53: To make this block in Scratch follow these steps:
hardTutorialSentence56: 3. Name your block and press ok.
hardTutorialSentence58: turns a random number from 0 to 359 degrees and moves variation of steps.
hardTutorialSentence59: Variation is a variable like x2, y2 and num clones that changes the motion of each individual donuts.
hardTutorialSentence60: To make a variable Click Variables in Scratch and click Make a variable and name this variable variation
hardTutorialSentence61: In the stage sprite we then set variation to 5 and num clones to answer.

hardTutorialSentence66: loop forever a message and glide for 5 seconds to a random position.

hardTutorialSentence72: if Squirrel2 donuts is greater then 99 then loop forever.
hardTutorialSentence73: We set Squirrel2's size to 100% and switch backdrop to stars and stop all other commands.
hardTutorialSentence75: if Squirrel2 donuts is greater then 99 then say a message.

hardTutorialSentence78: You can also draw on your sprite to make your character anything you want it to be.
hardTutorialSentence79: Click costumes in the scratch editor and click fill to choose your color!
hardTutorialSentence80: You can draw, create a line, circle, square, add text, fill an area with color, erase and select your sprite.
hardTutorialSentence81: Now your sprite will look like what you have drawn in game.
